contact.title: Contact
contact.desc:
If you have a question or comment about this platform, please fill in below. We will respond as soon as possible. We are open to any suggestions and/or improvements of our services.

Try to describe as precisely as possible what exactly happens, hereby indicating date and time. Try to indicate which lady you had contact with (name and item number). Try also to indicate which ISP (eg KPN, UPC, etc.), browser and version (eg Internet Explorer 8, Chrome 23, etc.), operating system and version (eg, Windows XP, OS X, etc.) and what version Flash player you are using (eg Player version 11.3.376.12 in IE 8, Chrome 11.5.31.2, etc.).
Thanks for the feedback!

textpages.termsdesc:
Welcome to the adult community Platform run by Sensemakers B.V. The following General Terms and Conditions apply to all Users who visit a Sensemakers Platform or any other device (including a smartphone or other device) and purchase Services there.

Sensemakers B.V. is established and has its registered office at (1322 BJ) Almere at Monitorweg 17 and is registered in the commercial register of the Chamber of Commerce for Gooiland, Eemland and Flevoland under number 33128110. Sensemakers can be reached via gigacams.com and at +31(0)36-5458595. VAT number Sensemakers B.V.: 803697041.B01.

1. Definitions

In these General Terms and Conditions, the following definitions apply:

1.1 Account: That part of the Platform where, using a log-in combination, the User can purchase Services and manage her Profile and personal details;

1.2 General Terms and Conditions: these terms and conditions and any additions thereto or amendments thereof;

1.3 Cookie Policy: the regulations that describe the manner in which gigacams.com uses cookies, and which types of cookies it uses;

1.4 Credits: the balance the User has purchased in advance by means of a payment system certified by the Platform, which he/she can use to safely purchase Wallet Services on demand;

1.5 Services: the services offered by the Performers via the relevant Platform, including but not limited to video chats, multi-platform activities, video calls, regular calls, email services and text message services, as well as other services;

1.6 User: every natural person (or legal entity) visiting the Platform and/or making use of the Services offered via the Platform;

1.7 Performer: every natural person who offers Services to one or more Users via the Platform;

1.8 Platform: the technical infrastructure Sensemakers makes available for the provision of Services;

1.9 Premium Services: the added value service offered to Users by means of the Platform, which are offered using numbers that are subject to a special rate;

1.10 Privacy Rules: the regulations concerning the processing of personal data for the benefit of using the Services and the Premium Services.

1.11 Profile: The information and files about themselves that the User and/or Performer posts on the Platform, consisting of – among other things – text, images, video material and audio material.

1.12 Sensemakers: the party running the Platform, Sensemakers B.V.

1.13 Wallet Services: the added value service offered to Users by means of the Platform, which are offered using Credits the User has purchased in advance.

2. Applicability

2.1 These General Terms and Conditions apply to all Users of the Platform and to all Services that are offered or purchased via the Platform.

2.2 The User can store or print the text of these General Terms and Conditions to read them at a later stage. To that end, Sensemakers makes the electronic version of the General Terms and Conditions available in such manner that the User can easily save these on a durable data carrier. If this is not reasonably possible, Sensemakers will, at the User’s request, either by electronic mail or otherwise, send the User the General Terms and Conditions free of charge.

2.3 Where these General Terms and Conditions refer to ‘Services’ or service provision, this always includes the Premium Services and the Wallet Services, unless and insofar as this is expressly stated otherwise.

2.4 Additions to or amendments of these General Terms and Conditions only apply if Sensemakers has expressly accepted these in writing. Sensemakers reserves the right to amend the General Terms and Conditions from time to time.

2.5 Sensemakers reserves the right to amend the General Terms and Conditions from time to time and will announce this before the amendment takes effect. If the User does not wish to accept the amendment to the General Terms and Conditions, they may stop using the Platform.

2.6 If one or more stipulations in these General Terms and Conditions prove to be void or voidable, in full or in part, the other stipulations will continue to apply unchanged.

3. Formation of the agreement

3.1 The agreement with the User is formed on (the first of) the following occasions: (1) the User purchases Services and the Performer provides the Services, or (2) the User has received a message stating that they have access to the Platform.

3.2 If, based on an investigation it has carried out (within the limits set by law), Sensemakers has good grounds to refuse the User access to the Platform, it is authorised to do so.

3.3 The User may terminate the agreement without having to provide reasons within fourteen (14) days, starting on the day the Agreement is entered into, unless and insofar as the provision of the Services has already started with the User’s permission before the reflection period has ended, in which case the User must pay for the use they have actually made of the Services (such as a chat session). Only insofar as they have created an Account, Users that want to exercise their right to terminate the agreement can use the standard form for terminations that can be found under the following link: Termination Form.

4. Contents and use of the Platform

4.1 Sensemakers runs a (hosting) platform on which Users and Performers can meet each other and communicate with each other without third-party intervention, including with multiple parties at the same time. Sensemakers is not a party to any arrangements made or agreements entered into between Users and Performers on or via the Platform.

4.2 Sensemakers does not perform a preventative check of the quality or the legitimacy of the Services offered and/or provided, but does at all times reserve the right to screen the contents of the interactions between the User and a Performer if, in its reasonable opinion, the circumstances necessitate this.

4.3 Sensemakers only provides Users access to the Services provided by the Performers that are offered by means of the Platform. If the User or the Performer is offended by the contents exchanged on the Platform, they can stop using the Platform at any time.

4.4 Users must be over eighteen (18) years of age. Sensemakers may set additional requirements for Users who wish to make use of the Services and will inform the Users of this where applicable. If the User does not wish to comply with the additional conditions, they can stop purchasing Services or put an end to the provision of the Services with immediate effect, at all times.

4.5 Within the legal frameworks, Sensemakers is permitted to determine whether the Performer meets the requirements and conditions that apply to the provision of the Services.

4.6 The User is strictly forbidden from using the Platform to engage in activities, behave in a manner or upload material that is liable to punishment, unlawful, hurtful, constitutes infringement or is offensive to others – which includes the Performer or other Users – or prejudices the rights of others in any way. Sensemakers reserves the right to refuse Users who engage in such activities or behave in such a manner access to the Platform and/or the Account with immediate effect if it is of the opinion that the User has violated the rules.

4.7 Sensemakers is not liable for the correctness or completeness of or statements in the contents of the information that Users provide via the Platform or elsewhere, such as in the User’s profile.

4.8 Users are forbidden from presenting themselves as and/or pretending to be someone else, or claiming to have characteristics other than those the User themselves possess. In that regard, the User is requested to always report any violation of the aforementioned rule to Sensemakers.

4.9 Use of Wallet Services is possible if the User has purchased Credits. In such case, the User can purchase Services on call. The User may request that the amount paid for the Wallet Services be refunded to the bank account used for the transaction for up to three months after purchase.

4.10 If a User so desires, or if they wish to purchase Premium Services, they must create an Account. In addition, after creating an Account, they can also create their own personal profile, using an alias, insofar as Sensemakers allows this. Furthermore, Sensemakers may enable the User to upload such matters as moving images and sound to the Platform. The User guarantees the correctness of the data or personal data provided by them for the Account – including the payment details – at all times. In addition, when uploading and exchanging content, the User will not spread computer viruses or other harmful elements.

4.11 At all times, Sensemakers is authorised to refuse a User an Account or close such Account if the User violates the stipulations in these General Terms and Conditions or otherwise commits unlawful acts.

5. Availability of the Platform/Services

5.1 Sensemakers will make every effort to ensure that the Services provided to the Users are provided without interruption or disruption. However, Sensemakers cannot guarantee the continuous availability of the Services. Sensemakers will take appropriate technical and organisational measures to secure the electronic transfer and storage of data and ensure a safe web environment and payment environment.

5.2 Sensemakers is not liable for the correct operation of peripheral equipment, including but not limited to the computer or telephone and/or the camera used by the User.

5.3 Users must refrain from engaging in any activity that can endanger the safety and/or the continuity of the Platform.

5.4 Sensemakers reserves the right to take the Platform off-line in connection with work or maintenance at any desired time.

5.5 Sensemakers reserves the right to make changes to the Platform, which includes changes to the security of the (access to) the Platform.

6. Information on prices and payment methods for Users

6.1 Unless otherwise indicated, prices and fees for the use of the Platform or the purchase of Services are expressed in euros.

6.2 Sensemakers reserves the right to make changes to (the prices of) the Services.

6.3 Sensemakers only accepts payments made using the payment methods stated on the Platform, including for the Premium Services and the Wallet Services.

6.4 The payment of Credits bought to purchase Wallet Services are processed by independent third-party service providers and the Credits bought in this way will be added to the User’s Account Balance.

6.5 Sensemakers only compensates Users for Credits they have bought up to an amount determined by it in proportion to the Service purchased and the price thereof, and only if (all or some of the) Credits have been lost due to technical malfunction of the Platform, and such malfunction can be attributed to acts or omissions on the part of Sensemakers.

6.6 The User agrees to Sensemakers taking receipt of all the payments and processing these for the benefit of the Performer.

6.7 If, at any time, the User stops using the Wallet Services, they may request that the portion of the Credits that they have not used in the past three months be returned. Sensemakers will determine the counter value in euros, deducting an administrative fee charged to Sensemakers by – among others – third-party service providers.

7. Posting pictures and texts and intellectual property rights

7.1 All intellectual property rights to the (contents, design and infrastructure of the) Platform are vested in Sensemakers or its suppliers. The User is forbidden from posting pictures or texts with contents that are punishable by law or constitute infringement.

7.2 Except with the prior written permission from Sensemakers, the User is forbidden from reproducing, copying or duplicating (parts of) the Platform.

8. Liability

8.1 Sensemakers is not liable for any direct or indirect loss arising from access to, the use of or the interpretation of the Services offered and/or the Platform.

8.2 Sensemakers is not liable for the contents and the quality of the Services provided by the Performers and will not pay Users compensation in this regard.

8.3 Sensemakers is also not liable for any shortcoming(s) in the performance, interruptions, defects or communication failures, or theft of or unauthorised access to, changes in or use of data or personal data or any other cause of a claim for any amount in excess of the amount the User has paid Sensemakers.

8.4 Users must report complaints to Sensemakers’ Customer Care department within 24 hours of the incident on which these are based. The contact details of the department are available on the Platform.

8.5 Sensemakers accepts no liability for the passing on of any information via the Platform, as Sensemakers does not take the initiative to pass on such information or provide or purchase the Services, does not determine to whom the information is passed on and does not select or alter the information continuously or in advance.

8.6 Sensemakers is not liable for the use of third-party hyperlinks that link to the Platform.

9. Complaints procedure

9.1 If they have any complaints, the User must turn to the Customer Care department. To that end, the User can send an email to the email address indicated on the Platform:

9.2 Sensemakers may (but is not obliged to) investigate the matter in connection with the complaint, and may decide to remove the offensive and/or infringing pictures and/or texts and/or decide to exclude the Performer. Sensemakers will make every reasonable effort to keep offensive and/or infringing content off the Platform. As soon as Sensemakers is informed of activities that are in conflict with the General Terms and Conditions, or Sensemakers concludes that such activities have taken place through its own observations, Sensemakers will make every effort to put an end to/remove these.

9.3 Determining and deciding whether certain behaviour on the part of or content can be considered offensive and/or constitutes an infringement is entirely at Sensemakers’ discretion.

9.4 Complaints are handled confidentially. The User may expect a response to a complaint within 14 days of Sensemakers’ receipt thereof.

10. Privacy and control

10.1 Sensemakers safeguards the safety and security of the User’s personal data and will under no circumstances provide details to a third party unless it is required to do so. The use of the Platform and the provision of Services is subject to the Privacy Regulations. The Privacy Regulations can be found on the Platform.

10.2 The personal information received is used to safeguard the quality of the Services, develop new services and operate the Platform. In addition, the information can be used to investigate, define and/or clear up any identified actions that may be in conflict with the General Terms and Conditions or the Privacy Regulations.

10.3 Furthermore, if the User makes use of an internet connection to do so – using the Platform and the provision of Services is subject to the Cookie Policy.

11. Acts in conflict with the General Terms and Conditions

11.1 In derogation from the other stipulations in these General Terms and Conditions, Sensemakers reserves the right to exclude the User from any further use of the Platform if Sensemakers considers the use thereof to be (in any way) in conflict with these General Terms and Conditions or applicable Dutch law, without prejudice to Sensemakers’ right to take additional legal action against the User and to claim compensation.

12. Disputes and applicable law

12.1 Sensemakers is not involved in any potential disputes between the User and the Performer.

12.2 All agreements to which Sensemakers is a party and these General Terms and Conditions are subject to Dutch law.

12.3 Insofar as derogation from the statutory rules of jurisdiction is permitted, the competent court in Amsterdam will hear any disputes that should arise between Sensemakers and the User, unless, within one month of Sensemakers relying on this article in writing, the User opts for the court with territorial jurisdiction. In addition, the User can make use of the following link in accordance with the relevant conditions of the law. http://ec.europa.eu/odr.
textpages.policydesc:
Applicability and scope of this Privacy Statement

This Privacy Statement applies to all services and activities of Sensemakers B.V., having its registered office in Almere, at Monitorweg 17 (1322 BJ), email: info@sensemakers.nl, and its affiliates that it has control of, unless such affiliates use their own privacy statement. If you purchase Services – such as adult entertainment – from Sensemakers (whether or not electronically, for example via the internet), or contact Sensemakers, the personal data you provide will be recorded and processed. Sensemakers is responsible for the processing of such details.

Sensemakers processes the details with due care and subject to the required confidentiality, in accordance with the conditions of the applicable privacy laws and regulations. Sensemakers strives to anonymise your personal data as much as possible.

Purposes of the data processing

We process your personal data to:

  • Enter into and perform agreements on the provision of our services and the associated information;
  • Allow for payments to be made and (where applicable) invoices to be sent, insofar as it concerns a paid service;
  • Manage your account with Sensemakers, if any;
  • Show you targeted advertisements of our service providers;
  • Enable you to have direct contact with our service providers or Users;
  • Keep you informed of Sensemakers’ services and manage the relationships that arise for you from our services;
  • Send you service messages or other messages (whether or not in electronic form);
  • Comply with the rules and regulations that apply to Sensemakers. For the aforementioned purposes, your personal data may be exchanged with or made available to all Sensemakers departments.

If you make use of our services electronically, an account may be automatically created for you, using the personal data you have already provided within the framework of an earlier visit. You can create an account yourself as well.

When you complete a contact or registration form on the website, create an account or send Sensemakers an email, the data you are submitting will be retained for as long as is needed, according to the nature of the form, the account or the email, for the purpose of answering and dealing with it in full.

Which details does Sensemakers process?

Depending on the service selected, Sensemakers may process – among other things – your (fixed or mobile) phone number and the IP address of your computer, your user name (if any), the time of the request and any details about a visitor that the browser sends along. These details are processed for the benefit of the aforementioned purposes and to optimise the functionality of the websites.

External service providers and other websites

In the event that using an electronic service provided by Sensemakers directs you to a third-party site or application, the conditions and privacy rules of the relevant partner or third party will apply.

Security of the details

Sensemakers will ensure that the storage of personal data in its administration is secure. The database is only accessible to Sensemakers employees insofar as this is required within the framework of their position. Furthermore, Sensemakers will make every reasonable effort to secure its systems against loss and/or any form of unlawful use or processing, making use of appropriate technical and organisational measures, taking account of – among other things – the technological state of the art.

Sensemakers will carefully consider how to deal with a data leak, with due observance of the applicable regulations.

However, Sensemakers’ liability for loss caused by third parties gaining unlawful access to computers or files, computer viruses spread via advertisements or other unlawful programs or files is excluded.

Provision of information to third parties

Without your express permission, Sensemakers will not provide personal data to parties that are not part of its group, except the following:

  • Sensemakers may provide your personal data to parties that Sensemakers engages in the performance of its services (such as a telecommunications provider). In such case, your details will only be used for the purposes for which you have provided them (such as using the service).
  • Pursuant to the applicable laws and regulations, Sensemakers may be obliged to provide personal data, for example within the framework of a criminal investigation. In such case, Sensemakers will only provide the personal data if it is clear that it is required to do so by law.

Inspection, correction and right to object

If you have a commercial relationship with Sensemakers, you can inspect your personal data upon written request. If, in your opinion, the overview provided by Sensemakers contains errors, you may request that these be corrected or deleted, in writing. In addition, using the aforementioned address, you can inform Sensemakers in writing if you do not wish to be approached with information about its services.

Cookies

If you use Sensemakers’ services electronically, Sensemakers may collect information on your use of these services, for example by means of cookies. More information on cookies can be found in the cookie statement.

Amendments to the Privacy Statement

Sensemakers reserves the right to amend this Privacy Statement. Any changes will be published on the relevant website.

This Privacy Statement was most recently amended on 23 March 2016. Sensemakers’ contact details can be found under the ‘contact’ hyperlink and at the bottom of the contact form on the website.
